text: Pours a pale golden colour with no head. Aromas of gooseberry, grass, and wild flowers. Very vinous, with a lovely sweet green apple skin finish. Fantastically balanced for a dessert cider.
Light apple colour. Mellow apple nose, bright. Sweet front, just a touch of tartness. Has a delicate spice. Bright, appley. Very drinkable, enjoyable.

750mL bottle, pours a clear dull blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out a lovely lightly sweet apple character, followed by treacle toffee. Flavour is super complex, with amazing depth of dry apples, champagne, caramel and treacle toffee. Warming in the best way possible, with a treacle, champagne-like finish. Fantastic stuff.

Corked bottle; 10.5% ABVYellow color, golden hue, with large bubbles, and small head. The aroma is very interesting; stewed apples, hazelnuts, wood, very light vanilla. Moderately sweet, moderately carbonated; it has a very nice flavor of apple juice, mature, mild apple strew feeling, and just the correct acidity; mild astringency in the final, apple skins.Really nice.
750ml bottle @ Alexs, pours a light golden clear colour. Nose of sweet funky apples. Flavour of very sweet apples and white wine. Carbonation is quite high making it champagne like.
Tasting at Alexs. Pours a clear pale golden with a small white head. Aroma and taste are sweet, fermented apples, pleasant. Very good one.

Bottle - Light funky apple and some peel notes. Clear sparkling gold. Bright and bubbly, funky and light sweetness with a dry and light acidic finish. Nice in the right situation, but not a regular drinker.

(10.5%) Cur de pomme, pelures et chair légèrement abimée par un air de campagne. Pommes entières dun verger tenu par des moines. Le fruit rond tient dans la paume de ma main qui travaille dans une terre sèche. Lalcool est complètement oublié. La viande blanche est juteuse et légèrement sucrée. Cest la beauté du fruit défendu. Bulles éclatantes et éclatées. Derrière le goût, les pommiers dans une érablière qui nattend certainement pas le printemps et le précieux travail des abeilles.

Bottle sampled at MdC 2015 with Linh, Ken and Nica. Pours a golden body. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with notes of bright tart apples, fruit skins, light maple, sweet honey and additional sugars. decent acidity on the palate and as others have mentioned, a bit of a tangy character to the profile.

[7064-20150215] Bottle. Mild apple Macintosh juice aroma. Clear, pale yellow body with quick bubbles. Light apple juicy tang flavour. Medium body. Good. (7/3/8/4/15) 3.7
(Mondial des Cidres @ Complexe Desjardins, Montreal, QC)

2015-02-15. Crispy dark yellow body with a small off white foam. 3+ Aroma is lovely - like smelling a basket of freshly picked apples. Sweet with a touch of apple skins but more in the sense of fresh ripe apple skin than the rougher note that description can sometimes imply. Flavour is relatively sweet but not cloyingly so, lightly syrupy sweetness alternates with fresh apple character (sort of Macintosh like?) and a light acidity that brings balance, and just a kiss of earthy apple notes in the finish. Just a touch milder overall than my preference but pleasantly subtle and nuanced. Smooth average plus to medium bodied palate, soft carbonation.3+ Just different enough from other ciders to be very interesting. I bought a bottle to bring home, hopefully it lives up to my first impressions. Bottle at Mondial des Cidres, Montreal.

Bottle @ Mondial des Cidres de Glace 2015. Lightly carbonated golden colored cider. Sweet apple and light grass on the nose. Kind of mild, but there is a solid fruit character. Subtle candy apple and yeast. Good acidity on the tongue. Crisp apple, some tarts (pastry), and candy apple.
A golden cider with aroma of tart apples, light maple, alcohol warmth nice. In mouth, a nice sweet tart apples with light acidity, very nice. Bottle at Mondial des Cidres 2015.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2015 clear pale golden pour with some nice bubbles. lightly sweet apples, cooked and lightly caramelized, few floral and spicy notes, champagne-like yeastiness. some sweetness - relatively important concentration, chalk. lively carbonation, medium body - some texture but a bit heavy, sweet-ish spicy-fruity yeasty finish. nicely crafted sweet bubbles. nice.

Pouring at Le Mondial des Cidres Glaces.  Aromas of apple candy, tart and warm on the nose.  Bright and lively with some champagne yeast notes paired up with some sweet apple.  Moves into a dry and clean finish with some crisp lingering acid notes.  Surprising.
